thread.title: Chinese yuan weakens

author: Wires English | Indo-Asian News Service
title: Chinese yuan weakens
text:
Comments 
The central parity rate of the Chinese currency renminbi, or the yuan, retreated by 98 basis points to 6.3595 against the US dollar on Friday, according to the China Foreign Exchange Trading System. In Chinaâ€™s spot foreign exchange market, the yuan is allowed to rise or fall by two percent from the central parity rate each trading day, Xinhua reported. 
The central parity rate of the yuan against the US dollar is based on a weighted average of prices offered by market makers before the opening of the interbank market each business day. But US dollar rises. 
The US dollar increased against most major currencies as investors were digesting better-than-expected jobless data from the country as well as the outcome of just-ended European Central Bank (ECB) meeting. 
In late New York trading on Thursday, the euro fell to $1.1112 from $1.1337 in the previous session, while the dollar bought 120.71 Japanese yen, higher than 119.95 yen of the previous session, Xinhua reported.
